Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a lekanis; interior glazed (fired red); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of tail of bird or siren to right with added red band on tail and dots on tail feathers.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 475, no. B821)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0778) (Phase 1)
